intro: Praealstonia reflexa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of vibrant, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of purple, blue, and white. The plant thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Praealstonia reflexa is a member of the Gesneriaceae family, which includes other popular ornamental plants.
